review_title: Amazing people in a small town
pros: The people here are super supportive, happy, and great to work with. Especially, President Wee, he's a great person to work for.
cons: Salary can be a bit low compared to other colleges.

pros: Community of staff is great, work can be rewarding.
cons: Not paid enough for the work you do, support staff are overlooked and overused. Major burnout because not only are we not paid enough, we also don’t get to participate in fun community building events because we’re too busy/ not allowed.

review_title: Leadership leading by example. A great place to work.
pros: Good benefits, a great, flexible working environment with team members that actually LOVE what they do. Don't be put off if salaries seem a bit low. There are intangibles that more than make up for it. I spent 26 years of my career here.
cons: Depending on which campus you are based out of, you could find yourself VERY rural.

job_title: Senior Human Resources Director in Calmar, IA
pros: Great benefits, meaningful work, flexible organization with people who truly care about each other.
The job description includes a level of autonomy. The work hours are flexible.
cons: No substitute instructors, long hours prepping for new semester, high expectations for student retention and using lowest cost online learning tools. Time-intensive. No secretaries.
A lot of chiefs, high insurance premiums

review_title: NICC gave me the opportunity to develop my own courses and was very rewarding
pros: Everyone seemed to work well together and there was great communication between faculty members.
cons: The only downside was the pay, as it was the lowest paying college that I have worked for and the pay never increased over the years as I gained seniority.

pros: easy going, relaxed work, friendly coworkers
cons: people living in this area seem to have racism in their mind
